trans-unit.source: Code Sample: ASP.NET Simple Forms
trans-unit.target: Code Sample: ASP.NET Simple Forms

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Code Sample: ASP.NET Simple Forms
trans-unit.target: Code Sample: ASP.NET Simple Forms

trans-unit.source: This sample illustrates how to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with an ASP.NET Web Forms application.
trans-unit.target: This sample illustrates how to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with an ASP.NET Web Forms application.

trans-unit.source: The code for this sample is located in the ASPNETSimpleForms (C#\Websites/ASPNETSimpleForms) subdirectory of the <token>ad_acs_code_gallery</token> package.
trans-unit.target: The code for this sample is located in the ASPNETSimpleForms (C#\Websites/ASPNETSimpleForms) subdirectory of the <token>ad_acs_code_gallery</token> package.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To run this sample, you will need:
trans-unit.target: To run this sample, you will need:

trans-unit.source: An account in the Azure portal and an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: An account in the Azure portal and an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: <token>vs2010</token> (any version)
trans-unit.target: <token>vs2010</token> (any version)

trans-unit.source: Windows Identity Foundation SDK
trans-unit.target: Windows Identity Foundation SDK

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <externalLink><linkText>ACS Prerequisites</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065).
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <externalLink><linkText>ACS Prerequisites</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065).

trans-unit.source: Configuring the Sample
trans-unit.target: Configuring the Sample

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration required for this sample can be performed by using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration required for this sample can be performed by using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes both options.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes both options.

trans-unit.source: Option 1: Configuring the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Option 1: Configuring the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Option 2: Configuring the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: Option 2: Configuring the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: Option 1: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Option 1: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal

trans-unit.source: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Access Control Service management portal.
trans-unit.target: This action opens the Access Control Service management portal.

trans-unit.source: To establish relationships with the identity providers you would like the users of your website to use when logging in, click <ui>Identity providers</ui>, and add <ui>Yahoo!</ui> and <ui>Google</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To establish relationships with the identity providers you would like the users of your website to use when logging in, click <ui>Identity providers</ui>, and add <ui>Yahoo!</ui> and <ui>Google</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Then click <ui>Home</ui> to return to the main page.
trans-unit.target: Then click <ui>Home</ui> to return to the main page.

trans-unit.source: To register your application with <token>secondref_acs</token>, click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>, and then enter the following information in the form:
trans-unit.target: To register your application with <token>secondref_acs</token>, click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>, and then enter the following information in the form:

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter <ui>ASPNET Simple Forms Sample</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter <ui>ASPNET Simple Forms Sample</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Realm</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:62000/</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Realm</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:62000/</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Return URL</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:62000/</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Return URL</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:62000/</ui>

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>SAML 2.0</ui> from the <ui>Token format</ui> drop-down list box.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>SAML 2.0</ui> from the <ui>Token format</ui> drop-down list box.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Identity providers</ui> section, select <ui>Google</ui>, <ui><token>windows_live_id</token></ui>, and <ui>Yahoo!</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Identity providers</ui> section, select <ui>Google</ui>, <ui><token>windows_live_id</token></ui>, and <ui>Yahoo!</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Token signing</ui> field, select <ui>Use service namespace certificate (standard)</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Token signing</ui> field, select <ui>Use service namespace certificate (standard)</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Leave the other fields at their default values.
trans-unit.target: Leave the other fields at their default values.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui> and then navigate to the main page.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui> and then navigate to the main page.

trans-unit.source: With your relying party application registered, it is now time to create the rules that determine the claims that <token>secondref_acs</token> will issue to your application.
trans-unit.target: With your relying party application registered, it is now time to create the rules that determine the claims that <token>secondref_acs</token> will issue to your application.

trans-unit.source: In this sample, we will simply pass through all the claims issued by the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, we will simply pass through all the claims issued by the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: To create this rule, click <ui>Rule Groups</ui> and then click <ui>Default Rule Group for ASPNET Simple Forms Sample</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To create this rule, click <ui>Rule Groups</ui> and then click <ui>Default Rule Group for ASPNET Simple Forms Sample</ui>.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click the <ui>Generate</ui> link.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click the <ui>Generate</ui> link.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the three identity providers <ui>Yahoo!</ui>, <ui>Google</ui>, and <ui><token>ssWLiveID</token></ui> are selected and click <ui>Generate</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the three identity providers <ui>Yahoo!</ui>, <ui>Google</ui>, and <ui><token>ssWLiveID</token></ui> are selected and click <ui>Generate</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Finally, click <ui>Save</ui> and navigate back to the main page.
trans-unit.target: Finally, click <ui>Save</ui> and navigate back to the main page.

trans-unit.source: With <token>secondref_acs</token> configured, open <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: With <token>secondref_acs</token> configured, open <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: To configure the sample, open <ui>SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui> (acs\Management\ManagementService\Common).
trans-unit.target: To configure the sample, open <ui>SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui> (acs\Management\ManagementService\Common).

trans-unit.source: Replace the placeholders in the <system>SamplesConfiguration</system> class in the Common class library with information about your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: Replace the placeholders in the <system>SamplesConfiguration</system> class in the Common class library with information about your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: You can find the information in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can find the information in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To navigate to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal: <token>ad_acs_portal</token> <token>ad_acs_manage_namespace</token>
trans-unit.target: To navigate to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal: <token>ad_acs_portal</token> <token>ad_acs_manage_namespace</token>

trans-unit.source: <ui>ServiceNamespace</ui> - Enter the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ServiceNamespace</ui> - Enter the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityName</ui> - Enter the name of an <token>secondref_acs</token> management service account.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityName</ui> - Enter the name of an <token>secondref_acs</token> management service account.

trans-unit.source: The default is <system>ManagementClient</system>.
trans-unit.target: The default is <system>ManagementClient</system>.

trans-unit.source: To find the management service account name, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the management service account name, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The accounts are listed by name under <ui>Management Service Accounts</ui>.
trans-unit.target: The accounts are listed by name under <ui>Management Service Accounts</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityKey</ui> - Enter the password for the management service account.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityKey</ui> - Enter the password for the management service account.

trans-unit.source: To find the management service account password, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the management service account password, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Management service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of a management service account, and then, under <ui>Credentials</ui>, click <ui>Password</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of a management service account, and then, under <ui>Credentials</ui>, click <ui>Password</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The password appears in the <ui>Password</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: The password appears in the <ui>Password</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: To copy the password, click <ui>Show Password</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To copy the password, click <ui>Show Password</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Run the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> application in <token>vs_current_short</token>, which will configure <token>secondref_acs</token> to run this sample.
trans-unit.target: Run the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> application in <token>vs_current_short</token>, which will configure <token>secondref_acs</token> to run this sample.

trans-unit.source: Running the Sample
trans-unit.target: Running the Sample

trans-unit.source: To run the sample
trans-unit.target: To run the sample

trans-unit.source: Open the sample located at <ui>Websites\ASPNETSimpleForms\ASPNETSimpleForms.sln</ui> in <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open the sample located at <ui>Websites\ASPNETSimpleForms\ASPNETSimpleForms.sln</ui> in <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: Press <ui>F5</ui> to start the application.
trans-unit.target: Press <ui>F5</ui> to start the application.

trans-unit.source: Close the browser to stop the application.
trans-unit.target: Close the browser to stop the application.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project and select <ui>Add STS Reference</ui> from the context menu.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project and select <ui>Add STS Reference</ui> from the context menu.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box, enter the root of the web application into the <ui>Application URI</ui> field and click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box, enter the root of the web application into the <ui>Application URI</ui> field and click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For this sample, this value is <ui>http://localhost:62000/</ui>
trans-unit.target: For this sample, this value is <ui>http://localhost:62000/</ui>

trans-unit.source: The trailing slash is important as it lines up with the values you entered in <token>secondref_acs</token> for your relying party.
trans-unit.target: The trailing slash is important as it lines up with the values you entered in <token>secondref_acs</token> for your relying party.

trans-unit.source: The wizard will issue a warning that your site is not using SSL.
trans-unit.target: The wizard will issue a warning that your site is not using SSL.

trans-unit.source: Accept this warning by clicking the <ui>Yes</ui> button, but remember that a production website should almost always use SSL for these types of scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Accept this warning by clicking the <ui>Yes</ui> button, but remember that a production website should almost always use SSL for these types of scenarios.

trans-unit.source: In the next window, select the <ui>Use Existing STS</ui> radio button and enter the URI of the WS-Federation metadata published by your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>. That URI can be found in the portal under <ui>Application Integration</ui>. If your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> is <ui>acssamples</ui>, the URI is <ui>https://acssamples. accesscontrol.windows.net/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml</ui>. After you enter the value, click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the next window, select the <ui>Use Existing STS</ui> radio button and enter the URI of the WS-Federation metadata published by your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>. That URI can be found in the portal under <ui>Application Integration</ui>. If your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> is <ui>acssamples</ui>, the URI is <ui>https://acssamples. accesscontrol.windows.net/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml</ui>. After you enter the value, click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Since your website does not require encrypted tokens, click <ui>Next</ui> on the remaining dialog boxes, and then click <ui>Finish</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Since your website does not require encrypted tokens, click <ui>Next</ui> on the remaining dialog boxes, and then click <ui>Finish</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Both <token>secondref_acs</token> and your application are now configured.
trans-unit.target: Both <token>secondref_acs</token> and your application are now configured.

trans-unit.source: Press <ui>F5</ui> in <token>vs_current_short</token> to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Press <ui>F5</ui> in <token>vs_current_short</token> to run the application.

trans-unit.source: Your browser will be taken to the <token>secondref_acs</token> hosted Home Realm Discovery page.
trans-unit.target: Your browser will be taken to the <token>secondref_acs</token> hosted Home Realm Discovery page.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Yahoo!</ui> or <ui>Google</ui> and your browser will be taken to that identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Yahoo!</ui> or <ui>Google</ui> and your browser will be taken to that identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Once your browser is at the identity provider, enter credentials for a test account, and accept the user consent form.
trans-unit.target: Once your browser is at the identity provider, enter credentials for a test account, and accept the user consent form.

trans-unit.source: Your browser should return to <ui>http://localhost:62000/</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Your browser should return to <ui>http://localhost:62000/</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the name of your test identity appears in the upper-right section of the page.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the name of your test identity appears in the upper-right section of the page.

trans-unit.source: This data was issued by the identity provider, and was returned to your application through <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This data was issued by the identity provider, and was returned to your application through <token>secondref_acs</token>.
